intro: Artanthe scopulorum, commonly known as the rock artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often in alpine or arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Artanthe scopulorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
